google_reviews.author: Jordan Graves
google_reviews.review:
If I could give 0 stars, I would. They took my application fee and an almost $200 holding fee and I never heard from them. No confirmation email, no phone call. Absolutely no follow up for months. I thought Id been scammed.

Recieved a call several months later saying that they had a property manager quit on the spot. And that theyd get my money back to me. Its been months since then and Ive still heard nothing. Do not apply to this place. They will scam you out of your money. The lack of professionalism is insane.

google_reviews.author: Brooke Lynn
google_reviews.review:
For rent controlled apartments the ground level suites are nice, large apartments. Modern appliances, no frills. No air conditioning though. Proportions of living room size to bedrooms isn't ideal, unless you entertain and use the living room a lot. Second bedroom is office sized, not a full bedroom.
Master bedroom has great lighting from the wall of windows. High ceiling is the best feature.  Energy from the street. You need to be creative in positioning the furniture.

Maintenance is all right but not consistent. Different person each time, some more helpful than others. Don't expect disability alterations the building isn't equipped for those despite what the ADA state law requires.

The application process needs improvement. Be prepared for confusing government forms and a month long process. It was traumatic.  Applying for government housing isn't the same as market rate, they don't follow the regular timelines of when you have to give notice to your previous landlord, they just tell you when you can move in at the last moment, so planning is difficult.
Miscommunications occur frequently.   We had to spend a week in a hotel waiting for the forms to be processed, fearing we'd be homeless because we'd already used up our rent money. Sacrifices had to be made though.

google_reviews.author: Leah Steele
google_reviews.review: Put a 150 dollar holding deposit that was refundable on an apartment and never got the money back after I decided to cancel on the apartment. Noted that the manager never disclosed there was a 3rd party involved with the money until after I inquired about getting my money back. What a dissapointment.

google_reviews.author: Evelyn Thompson
google_reviews.review: I have lived here for over 5 years. It's great besides the occasional inspections and fire alarm testing.

summary.text:
Good

In the midst of varying opinions on Walton Place, some pleasant experiences do stand out. For instance, a long-term resident who has lived there for over five years expressed satisfaction with their stay, highlighting that the general experience is "great." This sentiment provides a glimmer of hope about the living conditions at Walton Place, suggesting that for some, it offers a stable and content living environment. The positive aspects can be attributed to factors like the modern appliances found in the units, and unique features like the high ceilings and great lighting from wall-to-wall windows, which can contribute significantly to the comfort and appeal of an apartment.

Great

Additionally, the size of the ground-level suites appears to be considered generous by some, which can be quite valuable in rent-controlled apartments. This advantage points towards Walton Place offering above-average spacial accommodations in some of their units, which can be an important aspect for potential renters looking for roomy living quarters. However, details on the frequency of these observations are lacking within the user reviews, so it's challenging to weigh this as a consistent upside across the property.

Bad

Nevertheless, not all reviews of Walton Place are as favorable. Several users have reported issues with maintenance services—describing them as hit-or-miss depending on the technician, which indicates inconsistency in the quality of upkeep provided. Poor communication also seems to be a recurring theme, as reflected in a review where the user recounts a distressing application process with a significant lack of clarity and coordination. Such experiences can lead to unnecessary stress and can negatively impact the perception of professional competence within the company's management protocols.

Ugly

The most concerning aspects of Walton Place come from user reviews that shed light on severe mismanagement regarding financial transactions. Users have reported losing substantial application and holding fees without adequate follow-up or communication, and even described an occurrence of complete radio silence for months, which carries a haunting resemblance to a financial scam. This kind of negligence and lack of professionalism in handling client funds can quickly tarnish a company's reputation and is undoubtedly the ugliest part of the user experience at Walton Place, deterring potential residents from considering this property a trustworthy place to call home.
